**Orange dragon scales** are a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. They are made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.4 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Orange dragon scales are not randomly generated, though they can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").

A [orange dragon](/wiki/Orange_dragon "Orange dragon") that leaves a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") behind on death (i.e. always, unless killed by [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration")) have a 1⁄3 chance of leaving behind dragon scales, while a dragon revived by the [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning") or [spell of turn undead](/wiki/Spell_of_turn_undead "Spell of turn undead") only has a 1⁄20 chance to leave behind scales.[\[1\]](#cite_note-scalegen-1) Orange dragon scales dropped this way are always generated +0 and uncursed.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Description

While worn, orange dragon scales confer 3 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"). Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn orange dragon scales will convert them into [orange dragon scale mail](/wiki/Orange_dragon_scale_mail "Orange dragon scale mail"), with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing orange dragon scales will turn the wearer into a orange dragon, and doing so while wearing the scale mail will additionally revert them to scales.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scales#Strategy](/wiki/Dragon_scales#Strategy "Dragon scales")*

Orange dragon scales may seem somewhat more useful at a glance compared to other colors: most sources of [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") cannot be countered by [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") other than the breath weapon and [wand of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep"), falling asleep in combat is frequently lethal, and there are few other extrinsic sources of the resistance - a [ring of free action](/wiki/Ring_of_free_action "Ring of free action") only protects against the [potion of sleeping](/wiki/Potion_of_sleeping "Potion of sleeping") and its vapors. However, there are plenty of intrinsic sources in the form of [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), particularly those of [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") monsters, and [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") characters obtain the intrinsic at [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 4 - obtaining the intrinsic renders orange scales useless.

One potential use case for orange dragon scales is a non-elven [foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") [atheist](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist") character, who has fewer means of obtaining the property and is at particularly high risk from [sleeping gas traps](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Orange dragon scales are more likely to be considered for free action, which may free up a [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") slot for a character not reliant on body armor to cover reflection or [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance").

## History

Orange dragon scales first appear with most other colors of dragon scales in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0").

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give orange dragon scales additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of orange dragon scale armor. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make orange dragon scales and other colors more worthwhile.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn orange dragon scales [passively](/wiki/Passive "Passive") inflict [slowing](/wiki/Slowing "Slowing") on attackers.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon.

Orange dragon scales are effectively replaced by **sleep dragon scales**, which confer only 1 base AC like all dragon scales in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn orange dragon scales additionally confer free action and [hallucination resistance](/wiki/Hallucination_resistance "Hallucination resistance").

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn orange dragon scales additionally confer free action. They also weigh 300 aum like all dragon scales in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).
